column1: 4081289555,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-mediobanca-4081289555?position=1&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=XCZfUYbJw%2BmVGPz%2FIAboBQ%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Mediobanca,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Mediobanca is the leading investment bank in Italy. Internationally our footprint includes branches in London, Madrid, Paris and New York. Since Mediobanca was founded in 1946, we have been helping Italian businesses growth with premier advisory services and a complete range of credit solutions, offering customized services and the most sophisticated solutions on financial markets, from advisory to lending, capital markets to specialty finance. With our long-standing presence, solid market position, distinctive specialization, excellent service quality and professionals of the finest calibre, Mediobanca’s corporate customers know they can count on the excellence and exclusivity that have earned us an impeccable reputation over time. Our clients include some of the leading business groups in Italy, plus a significant number of mid-size corporates, to whom we have devoted particular attention over the past ten years. Increasing focus is also being placed on our international clients, for both their cross-border needs and domestic operations. We have introduced new products and targeted new clients in order to meet the challenges posed by today's highly competitive financial markets. As ever it is our clients, along with our professionals and the soundness of our finances, which represent the core values of Mediobanca.
Mediobanca is seeking a Data Scientist with a strong statistical background eager to work on the enhancement of the value of financial business related data by applying data-driven methodologies.
More specifically, the role holder will:
collect, examine, and analyze large amounts of financial data to identify patterns, trends, and opportunities useful for informed investment strategies and business decisions to be taken
utilize advanced statistical methods to develop models for the implementation of business cases
create customized tools and algorithms to automate complex processes, enhance efficiency and provide innovative solutions for business needs
supervise and actively participate to the implementation of the Group's AI data platform
proactively introduce the necessary governance for the implementation of AI use cases.

In a challenging yet collaborative work environment, the candidate will contribute to oversee several initiatives to move the data agenda forward and will be part of a broader transformation program at Group level without losing sight of regulatory requirements.

We are looking for motivated professionals with 2-4 years of work experience and a Bachelor or Master Degree in quantitative or business related subjects, such as Statistics, Mathematics, Engineering, Computer Science.
strong knowledge of statistical methodologies, modeling techniques, and machine learning algorithms
advanced programming skills, particularly in languages such as Python, R and one query language like SQL
understanding of fundamental principles of financial activities and capital markets
ability to work both autonomously and in team
excellent communication skills and ability to clearly present analysis results to non-technical stakeholders
strong intellectual curiosity and willingness to explore new approaches
a brief experience on NLP and Generative AI will be considered as a plus
proficiency in both written and spoken Italian and English languages.
Diversity & Inclusion are core values for the Mediobanca Group. All applications are welcome
column2: we value age, background, ability, personal orientation and gender expression diversity.

4071702807,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-at-reply-4071702807?position=2&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=pltGjiRGk5qxh2Qriu4wRg%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer,Reply,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Are you a brilliant new graduate, passionate about Big Data and Machine Learning? Do you think Artificial Intelligence is changing the world with groundbreaking innovation? Dive into Deep Learning algorithms and cutting-edge techniques to develop human-machine interaction.

A technological nirvana. At Reply, true innovation runs in our blood. We have a nerdy heart and we are proud of it. Cool tech stack, guaranteed hands-on experience, challenges, hackathons, table footballs and free coffee are already waiting for you.
A continuous learning experience. In Reply, what you know is never enough. Choose from internal webinars, learn from other Replyers and teach others what keeps you awake at night.
A structured career. The perfect path to your achievements. Now with a brand new Graduate Programme.
Academic background. With a brilliant Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or technical equivalent.
Teamwork mindset. In Reply, we believe in teamwork. Once here, your team will be your family and will guide you everywhere. We hope you will love it.
Curiosity and drive. We ask you to love what you do. And to always aim for excellence.

Reply is a company that specialises in Consulting, Systems Integration and Digital Services with a focus on the conception, design and implementation of solutions based on the new communication channels and digital media. Reply partners with key industrial groups in defining and developing business models made possible by the new technological and communication paradigms such as Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Cloud Computing, Digital Communication, the Internet of Things and Mobile and Social Networking.

Are you a brilliant new graduate, passionate about Big Data and Machine Learning? Do you think Artificial Intelligence is changing the world with groundbreaking innovation? Dive into Deep Learning algorithms and cutting-edge techniques to develop human-machine interaction.

Join Reply!


WHAT WE OFFER

  • A technological nirvana. At Reply, true innovation runs in our blood. We have a nerdy heart and we are proud of it. Cool tech stack, guaranteed hands-on experience, challenges, hackathons, table footballs and free coffee are already waiting for you.
  • A continuous learning experience. In Reply, what you know is never enough. Choose from internal webinars, learn from other Replyers and teach others what keeps you awake at night.
  • A structured career. The perfect path to your achievements. Now with a brand new Graduate Programme.


WHAT WE NEED

  • Academic background. With a brilliant Bachelor's or Master's degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science or technical equivalent.
  • Teamwork mindset. In Reply, we believe in teamwork. Once here, your team will be your family and will guide you everywhere. We hope you will love it.
  • Curiosity and drive. We ask you to love what you do. And to always aim for excellence.


WHO WE ARE

Reply is a company that specialises in Consulting, Systems Integration and Digital Services with a focus on the conception, design and implementation of solutions based on the new communication channels and digital media. Reply partners with key industrial groups in defining and developing business models made possible by the new technological and communication paradigms such as Artificial Intelligence, Big Data, Cloud Computing, Digital Communication, the Internet of Things and Mobile and Social Networking.

Feel interested?

<icon class=""show-more-less-html__button-icon show-more-less-button-icon lazy-loaded"" aria-hidden=""true"" aria-busy=""false""><svg xmlns=""http://www.w3.org/2000/svg"" width=""16"" height=""16"" preserveAspectRatio=""xMinYMin meet"" focusable=""false"" class=""lazy-loaded"" aria-busy=""false""><path d=""M8 7l-5.9 4L1 9.5l6.2-4.2c.5-.3 1.2-.3 1.7 0L15 9.5 13.9 11 8 7z"" fill=""currentColor""></path></svg></icon>

Empatica is a full-stack digital healthcare company and a pioneer in digital biomarker development and continuous patient monitoring driven by AI. Our platform consists of medical-grade smartwatches, software, and physiological and behavioral digital biomarkers. Together they enable the continuous remote monitoring of human health across a range of conditions, through clinical-quality digital measurements.
If you are looking to join a fast-paced growth environment and do meaningful work that can make a true impact in the world, then keep reading.

At Empatica, we work every single day to build products that help the lives of many patients. Our DataR&D team develops all the digital biomarkers that will be embedded in our products bringing them from their initial research stage to a clinically validated stage.

We are looking for a Data Scientist with a passion for science and scientific discovery, who has solid experience in navigating through complex data science challenges. If you are an independent, pragmatic, and goal-oriented person, who can achieve results in a timely manner, and also happens to be passionate about making a difference in the world, read on.

You will be involved in our R&D initiatives and will be working with our proprietary algorithms that, among many other things, help the lives of many patients every day. You will help solve challenging problems also by building algorithms to effectively measure outcomes starting from wearable sensors.
Develop digital biomarkers within our products by means of signal processing and Machine Learning techniques
Analyze and visualize physiological and behavioral data to extract meaningful knowledge associated with the mental or physical diseases we are dealing with
Drive initiatives (i.e., Literature research, technical feasibility assessments, solution proposal and design, team discussion, and team coordination) to further improve Empatica's product offering

Lead or support the design, execution, and monitoring of protocols to collect data during internal or external clinical studies involving human subjects (i.e., statistical analysis plans, data development plans, dataset preparation, clinical performance evaluation).
Manage communication with partner institutions conducting clinical studies with our products (i.e., handle meetings and communication with external stakeholders, solve technical challenges)
Empatica operates in an international environment with offices in Europe, the US, and Korea. All work is conducted in English
We are operating a hybrid model where our employees choose whether to work from home or come to the office
You are the ideal person for this job if you:

Have a Ph.D. in bioengineering or computer science. Preferred fields of application are: Neurology, Cardio-vascular diseases, Sleep analysis, Digital therapeutics, Fatigue detection, Pain monitoring, and Depression
Have worked a minimum of 3 years with medical or healthcare data
Are experienced in managing R&D projects in either in-company or academic settings
Are proficient in signal processing, statistical analysis, and the development of machine learning algorithms
Have a proven track record of coordinating or taking part in clinical and/or research studies
Have strong programming skills in one or more of the following languages:
Have experience in healthcare applications, or a strong interest and desire to learn about them
Are proficient in English (mother tongue is a plus)
Have a passion for Empatica's products and mission
Have resilience, a get-things-done attitude, and an innate desire to do great work

You will join a fast-growing, international, and diverse team of 110+ talented people who care passionately about what we do and the difference we are making in the world. You'll get the opportunity to work directly with colleagues across all levels of the organization, no matter their seniority, and learn from the people that built the business and our products.

If you jump on board, we can guarantee it won't be an easy ride, but it will be one of the most rewarding experiences in your career, one that will allow you to learn a lot, have true ownership of your work, and test your whole skillset on multiple projects which are helping thousands of people worldwide.
Read our blog post and find out some reasons why we love working at Empatica.
🧠 Multiple opportunities to be challenged and step up your career in a fast-growth company in one of the hottest areas of tech
📈 Employee stock options - we want everyone who joins us to own part of the company and our success
🏖️ We have offices in Milan City Center and Downtown Boston. And every summer, we hold an amazing beach retreat in Sardinia, Italy
🏋️‍♀️ Gympass membership with access to gyms, online classes, personal training sessions, and nutrition plans
😌 Membership for mental health and wellness platforms
🍪 Free cookies, if you deserve them

Empatica

Empatica is a full-stack digital healthcare company and a pioneer in digital biomarker development and continuous patient monitoring driven by AI. Our platform consists of medical-grade smartwatches, software, and physiological and behavioral digital biomarkers. Together they enable the continuous remote monitoring of human health across a range of conditions, through clinical-quality digital measurements.

If you are looking to join a fast-paced growth environment and do meaningful work that can make a true impact in the world, then keep reading.

About The Role

At Empatica, we work every single day to build products that help the lives of many patients. Our DataR&
column2:
D team develops all the digital biomarkers that will be embedded in our products bringing them from their initial research stage to a clinically validated stage.

We are looking for a Data Scientist with a passion for science and scientific discovery, who has solid experience in navigating through complex data science challenges. If you are an independent, pragmatic, and goal-oriented person, who can achieve results in a timely manner, and also happens to be passionate about making a difference in the world, read on.

You will be involved in our R&
column3:
D initiatives and will be working with our proprietary algorithms that, among many other things, help the lives of many patients every day. You will help solve challenging problems also by building algorithms to effectively measure outcomes starting from wearable sensors.

You will:

  • Develop digital biomarkers within our products by means of signal processing and Machine Learning techniques
  • Analyze and visualize physiological and behavioral data to extract meaningful knowledge associated with the mental or physical diseases we are dealing with
  • Drive initiatives (i.e., Literature research, technical feasibility assessments, solution proposal and design, team discussion, and team coordination) to further improve Empatica's product offering
  • Lead or support the design, execution, and monitoring of protocols to collect data during internal or external clinical studies involving human subjects (i.e., statistical analysis plans, data development plans, dataset preparation, clinical performance evaluation).
  • Manage communication with partner institutions conducting clinical studies with our products (i.e., handle meetings and communication with external stakeholders, solve technical challenges)


Some important details:

  • Empatica operates in an international environment with offices in Europe, the US, and Korea. All work is conducted in English
  • We are operating a hybrid model where our employees choose whether to work from home or come to the office


Requirements

You are the ideal person for this job if you:

  • Have a Ph.D. in bioengineering or computer science. Preferred fields of application are: Neurology, Cardio-vascular diseases, Sleep analysis, Digital therapeutics, Fatigue detection, Pain monitoring, and Depression
  • Have worked a minimum of 3 years with medical or healthcare data
  • Are experienced in managing R&
column4:
D projects in either in-company or academic settings
  • Are proficient in signal processing, statistical analysis, and the development of machine learning algorithms
  • Have a proven track record of coordinating or taking part in clinical and/or research studies
  • Have strong programming skills in one or more of the following languages:
    • Matlab
    • Python
  • Have experience in healthcare applications, or a strong interest and desire to learn about them
  • Are proficient in English (mother tongue is a plus)
  • Have a passion for Empatica's products and mission
  • Have resilience, a get-things-done attitude, and an innate desire to do great work

    • Life at Empatica

    You will join a fast-growing, international, and diverse team of 110+ talented people who care passionately about what we do and the difference we are making in the world. You'll get the opportunity to work directly with colleagues across all levels of the organization, no matter their seniority, and learn from the people that built the business and our products.

    If you jump on board, we can guarantee it won't be an easy ride, but it will be one of the most rewarding experiences in your career, one that will allow you to learn a lot, have true ownership of your work, and test your whole skillset on multiple projects which are helping thousands of people worldwide.

    Read our blog post and find out some reasons why we love working at Empatica.

    Benefits

    • 🧠 Multiple opportunities to be challenged and step up your career in a fast-growth company in one of the hottest areas of tech
    • 💰 Competitive salary
    • 📈 Employee stock options - we want everyone who joins us to own part of the company and our success
    • 🏖️ We have offices in Milan City Center and Downtown Boston. And every summer, we hold an amazing beach retreat in Sardinia, Italy
    • 🏥 Health Insurance
    • 🏋️‍♀️ Gympass membership with access to gyms, online classes, personal training sessions, and nutrition plans
    • 😌 Membership for mental health and wellness platforms
    • 🥗 Free healthy lunch every day
    • 🤓 Free Kindle and books
    • 🕰️ Flexible working hours
    • 🧑‍🎓 Personal learning and development budget
    • 🍪 Free cookies, if you deserve them
    • 👀 Much more..

4044704634,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-at-lynx-spa-4044704634?position=8&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=c63DedRuze3PaGVTg8ElJw%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer,Lynx Spa,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Il Gruppo Lynx è specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni software presente in Italia, Spagna e America Latina con oltre 1.100 risorse ed è da anni partner di primarie realtà internazionali in molti settori di mercato, fra i quali Finance, Energy e Insurance.

I contesti che ci vedono protagonisti sul mercato sono caratterizzati da una forte componente innovativa, come ad esempio l’uso di metodologie quali DevOps, Agile e tecnologie Microservizi, front-end web innovativi, Big Data, Machine Learning, Intelligenza Artificiale e Cyber Security.
Siamo alla ricerca di un Machine Learning Engineer con almeno 3 anni di esperienza nel campo del machine learning e dell'intelligenza artificiale.

Il candidato ideale sarà responsabile della progettazione, sviluppo e implementazione di soluzioni di machine learning su larga scala, collaborando con team interfunzionali per portare i modelli AI dalla fase sperimentale alla produzione.
Sviluppo e ottimizzazione di modelli di machine learning per applicazioni reali, con particolare attenzione alla scalabilità e alle performance.
Collaborazione con team di data science e ingegneria per integrare soluzioni ML nei sistemi di produzione.
Implementazione e gestione di pipeline ML end-to-end, inclusa l'acquisizione dei dati, il preprocessing, l'addestramento e la distribuzione dei modelli.
Monitoraggio continuo delle performance dei modelli in produzione e ottimizzazione degli stessi per migliorare precisione, velocità e robustezza.
Gestione del ciclo di vita dei modelli di machine learning, compreso il retraining e il deployment continuo (MLOps).
Sperimentazione e implementazione di nuove tecniche e algoritmi di machine learning, inclusi deep learning e reinforcement learning.
Garantire la conformità delle soluzioni AI alle normative e alle best practice in termini di etica e sicurezza dei dati.
Almeno 3 anni di esperienza come Machine Learning Engineer o in ruoli simili.
Eccellente padronanza di Python e delle principali librerie di machine learning come scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch.
Esperienza con pipeline di machine learning e tool di MLOps (ad es. MLflow, Kubeflow o altri).
Conoscenza approfondita di tecniche di apprendimento supervisionato, non supervisionato e reinforcement learning.
Esperienza nell'ottimizzazione di modelli ML per la produzione su larga scala e nella gestione di modelli in ambienti cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP).
Familiarità con i framework per la gestione di big data (ad es. Spark, Hadoop) e con i database SQL e NoSQL.
Capacità di collaborare efficacemente con data engineer, software engineer e stakeholder di business per integrare le soluzioni AI nei prodotti aziendali.
Competenze in containerizzazione (Docker, Kubernetes) per il deployment scalabile di modelli ML.
Esperienza con tecniche di deep learning e reti neurali complesse.
Competenza in ottimizzazione di modelli, tuning di iperparametri e tecniche avanzate di cross-validation.
Familiarità con tecniche di apprendimento federato o privacy-preserving machine learning.
Esperienza nell'integrazione di API ML in applicazioni aziendali.
Un ambiente di lavoro stimolante, con accesso a progetti innovativi e tecnologie all'avanguardia.
Opportunità di crescita professionale in un settore in rapida evoluzione.
Supporto alla formazione continua e partecipazione a conferenze tecniche.
Un pacchetto retributivo competitivo e incentivi in base ai risultati.
Assunzione a tempo indeterminato, stipendio adeguato alle competenze
Inquadramento e retribuzione saranno commisurati alla seniority e alle effettive capacità del candidato.
Sede di lavoro: Milano, in formula ibrida.

Gli interessati a questa posizione possono inviare il proprio CV, dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all’art. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679).

Il Gruppo Lynx è specializzato nella progettazione e realizzazione di soluzioni software presente in Italia, Spagna e America Latina con oltre 1.100 risorse ed è da anni partner di primarie realtà internazionali in molti settori di mercato, fra i quali Finance, Energy e Insurance.

I contesti che ci vedono protagonisti sul mercato sono caratterizzati da una forte componente innovativa, come ad esempio l’uso di metodologie quali DevOps, Agile e tecnologie Microservizi, front-end web innovativi, Big Data, Machine Learning, Intelligenza Artificiale e Cyber Security.


Descrizione del lavoro:


Siamo alla ricerca di un Machine Learning Engineer con almeno 3 anni di esperienza nel campo del machine learning e dell'intelligenza artificiale.

Il candidato ideale sarà responsabile della progettazione, sviluppo e implementazione di soluzioni di machine learning su larga scala, collaborando con team interfunzionali per portare i modelli AI dalla fase sperimentale alla produzione.


Responsabilità principali:


  • Sviluppo e ottimizzazione di modelli di machine learning per applicazioni reali, con particolare attenzione alla scalabilità e alle performance.
  • Collaborazione con team di data science e ingegneria per integrare soluzioni ML nei sistemi di produzione.
  • Implementazione e gestione di pipeline ML end-to-end, inclusa l'acquisizione dei dati, il preprocessing, l'addestramento e la distribuzione dei modelli.
  • Monitoraggio continuo delle performance dei modelli in produzione e ottimizzazione degli stessi per migliorare precisione, velocità e robustezza.
  • Gestione del ciclo di vita dei modelli di machine learning, compreso il retraining e il deployment continuo (MLOps).
  • Sperimentazione e implementazione di nuove tecniche e algoritmi di machine learning, inclusi deep learning e reinforcement learning.
  • Garantire la conformità delle soluzioni AI alle normative e alle best practice in termini di etica e sicurezza dei dati.


Requisiti:


  • Almeno 3 anni di esperienza come Machine Learning Engineer o in ruoli simili.
  • Eccellente padronanza di Python e delle principali librerie di machine learning come scikit-learn, TensorFlow, PyTorch.
  • Esperienza con pipeline di machine learning e tool di MLOps (ad es. MLflow, Kubeflow o altri).
  • Conoscenza approfondita di tecniche di apprendimento supervisionato, non supervisionato e reinforcement learning.
  • Esperienza nell'ottimizzazione di modelli ML per la produzione su larga scala e nella gestione di modelli in ambienti cloud (AWS, Azure, GCP).
  • Familiarità con i framework per la gestione di big data (ad es. Spark, Hadoop) e con i database SQL e NoSQL.
  • Capacità di collaborare efficacemente con data engineer, software engineer e stakeholder di business per integrare le soluzioni AI nei prodotti aziendali.
  • Competenze in containerizzazione (Docker, Kubernetes) per il deployment scalabile di modelli ML.


Preferenze:


  • Esperienza con tecniche di deep learning e reti neurali complesse.
  • Competenza in ottimizzazione di modelli, tuning di iperparametri e tecniche avanzate di cross-validation.
  • Familiarità con tecniche di apprendimento federato o privacy-preserving machine learning.
  • Esperienza nell'integrazione di API ML in applicazioni aziendali.


Cosa offriamo:


  • Un ambiente di lavoro stimolante, con accesso a progetti innovativi e tecnologie all'avanguardia.
  • Opportunità di crescita professionale in un settore in rapida evoluzione.
  • Supporto alla formazione continua e partecipazione a conferenze tecniche.
  • Un pacchetto retributivo competitivo e incentivi in base ai risultati.
  • Assunzione a tempo indeterminato, stipendio adeguato alle competenze


Inquadramento e retribuzione saranno commisurati alla seniority e alle effettive capacità del candidato.


Sede di lavoro: Milano, in formula ibrida.


Gli interessati a questa posizione possono inviare il proprio CV, dichiarando di concedere l'autorizzazione per il trattamento dei dati personali in base all’art. 13 del D.Lgs n.196/03 e all’art. 13 del GDPR (Regolamento UE 2016/679).

4068663802,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-internship-at-livanova-4068663802?position=10&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=IYNejJJ5JoE1BnZKVbvBaw%3D%3D,Data Scientist - Internship,LivaNova,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Join us today and make a difference in people's lives!
Join us today and make a difference in people's lives.
We are offering an Internship opportunity to talented candidates in the Data Science area in our Milan office.

In this role, you will have the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in data science, artificial intelligence (AI), and machine learning. You will collaborate with cross-functional teams to apply statistical techniques, develop machine learning models, and integrate AI-driven solutions into clinical trials and medical strategies.

You will be part of LivaNova, global medical technology company, worldwide leader in cardiovascular and neuromodulation solutions. With almost 3,000 colleagues in more than 100 countries we are facing a steady commercial growth to help creating products and therapies that transform people lives.

The program will provide education and hands-on training in data science, dashboarding, data visualization, and advanced analytics in real-world medical device projects and ensuring alignment with healthcare regulations. The trainee will execute cross-functional activities to ignite LivaNova medical excellence.
Assist in developing and enhancing dashboards to support NLP and AI capabilities.
Provide infrastructure support, focusing on the deployment of data-driven projects.
Contribute to R&D initiatives, with a particular focus on physiological control loops.
Collaborate with senior Data Scientists in validation activities.
Degree in Biomedical Engineering, Biotechnology, Statistics, Biostatistics, Pharmacy, or any other STEM.
Good knowledge of programming languages like Python or R
column2: SAS would be an advantage.

column1: A detail-oriented individual with a methodological and accuracy-driven approach.
Willingness to work in a collaborative environment with a global team.
LivaNova values equality and celebrates diversity. We are committed to ensuring that our recruitment process is fair, transparent and free from unlawful discrimination.

Our selection process is driven by the key demands/requirements for the role rather than bias or discrimination on the basis of a candidate’s sex, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, non-job-related disability/handicap or medical condition, family status, sexual orientation, religion, color, ethnicity, race or any other legally protected classification.

Please note that we do not accept unsolicited resumes from recruiters or employment agencies. In the absence of a signed Recruitment Services Agreement, we will not consider, or agree to, payment of any referral compensation or recruiter fee. In the event that a recruiter or agency submits a resume or candidate without a previously signed agreement, we explicitly reserve the right to pursue and hire those candidate(s) without any financial obligation to the recruiter or agency.

Please beware of potentially fraudulent job postings or suspicious recruiting activity by persons posing as LivaNova recruiters or employees. The scammers may attempt to solicit confidential, personal information, such as a social security number, or your financial information. LivaNova will never ask for fees prior/during/after the application process, nor will we ask for banking details or personal financial information in return for the assurance of employment. If you are concerned that an offer of employment might be a scam or that the recruiter is not legitimate, please verify by searching for “See Open Jobs” on https://www.livanova.com/en-us/careers, and check that all recruitment emails come from an @livanova.com email address.

3825899217,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-data-scientist-milano-cns-at-pwc-italy-3825899217?position=12&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=bFVvVzi6rpKSJzPK0gOKAQ%3D%3D,Junior Data Scientist - Milano [CNS],PwC Italy,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Vuoi essere al centro di prospettive di crescita uniche? Entra nella practice Technology Consulting di PwC e diventa:

Prenderai parte a diversi progetti di trasformazione del business dei principali players in ambito Automotive & Industrial Manufacturing, Consumer Markets, Energy & Utilities, Financial Services, Telco & Media attraverso l’efficientamento e la reingegnerizzazione dei processi interni.
Grazie all’accesso alle vaste competenze del nostro network internazionale, potrai dare spazio alle tue idee e fornire il contributo innovativo che hai sempre desiderato.
Sarai coinvolto in progetti di consulenza e maturerai esperienza in ambito Data Science, all’interno del team Data & Analytics.
Aiuterai i nostri clienti ad esplorare nuove opportunità di business sviluppando abilità quali:

Utilizzare in modo consapevole e bilanciato competenze analitiche, capacità decisionali e comprensione delle dinamiche di business nell'elaborazione di potenziali soluzioni alle criticità dei nostri clienti
Supportare i clienti a comprendere il valore aggiunto dell’adozione di Data Science, Machine Learning o Intelligenza Artificiale nelle loro realtà e a trarne il massimo beneficio
Sviluppare solide relazioni a tutti i livelli gerarchici, basate sulla reciproca fiducia in una realtà Worldwide
Essere proattivo nell'acquisire nuove conoscenze ed expertise
Comunicare ai clienti in modo chiaro ed efficace il valore aggiunto che PwC
Hai conseguito o stai conseguendo una laurea magistrale in Data Science, Statistica, Ingegneria Matematica, Fisica, Matematica o altre discipline scientifiche (area STEM).
Parli e scrivi in inglese fluentemente.
Costituisce titolo preferenziale la conoscenza delle principali tecniche di Machine Learning, Deep Learning e Advanced Analytics.
Costituisce titolo preferenziale la conoscenza di linguaggi di programmazione e software per l'analisi dei dati come Python, R e SAS.
Hai una forte propensione/interesse per le nuove tecnologie e per l’informatica.
Hai ottime capacità di analisi e di problem solving.
Sai lavorare per obiettivi e metterti in gioco con passione
Sei un team worker e hai buone capacità relazionali e comunicative.
Hai sempre la valigia pronta per un viaggio di lavoro e sei motivato all’attività di consulenza

4077264986,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-at-softwave-soluzioni-tecnologie-s-r-l-4077264986?position=13&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=1g%2Fd8Vj9umt3UedAPJf8Ig%3D%3D,Machine learning engineer,Softwave Soluzioni & Tecnologie S.r.l.,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Se sei alla ricerca di un ambiente dove condividere e valorizzare le tue idee ed esprimere al meglio la tua passione per la Data Science questa è la nostra proposta!
Per importanti progetti di Data Science presso primarie realtà del panorama IT con sede nella città di Milano, ma con la possibilità di svolgere l’attività anche in smart working ibrido.
Potrai confrontarti con ambienti dinamici e strutturati, lavorare in team su progetti di analisi dei dati e sviluppo di soluzioni basate sull’intelligenza artificiale.
Analizzerai dati complessi utilizzando strumenti statistici e algoritmi di machine learning.
Svilupperai e implementerai modelli AI, inclusi algoritmi di apprendimento automatico e reti neurali.
Ottimizzerai le prestazioni dei modelli tramite tecniche di training su grandi dataset.
Potrai creare modelli di interpretazione e generazione del linguaggio naturale (NLP) per applicazioni come chatbot e traduttori automatici.
Rappresenterai graficamente i dati con strumenti di visualizzazione.
Conoscenza del linguaggio Python e relative librerie di machine learning
Laurea magistrale su tematiche di Data science

column2: Range di RAL 26-32K

column1: Incentivi e bonus in base alla seniority e al raggiungimento di obiettivi professionali

Per importanti progetti di Data Science presso primarie realtà del panorama IT con sede nella città di Milano, ma con la possibilità di svolgere l’attività anche in smart working ibrido.

Skills:

4068353096,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-junior-at-manpowergroup-italia-4068353096?position=14&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=DoI7AnemrLBREN%2FsvD67Ew%3D%3D,Data Scientist Junior,ManpowerGroup Italia,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Working to change the world

Presente in Italia dal 1994, la realtà nazionale di ManpowerGroup - multinazionale leader nelle global workforce solutions - aiuta le aziende a trasformarsi in un mondo del lavoro in continuo cambiamento ricercando, valutando, formando e gestendo i talenti che consentono loro di competere e avere successo. Sviluppiamo soluzioni innovative per oltre 15.000 aziende e mettiamo in contatto oltre 100mila persone ogni anno con opportunità di lavoro in un’ampia gamma di settori e aree professionali.

Da oltre 20 anni crea valore per candidati e clienti con soluzioni strategiche per la gestione delle risorse umane, attraverso una rete di circa 230 uffici e impiegando 1.800 persone in tutto il territorio nazionale.
Per il potenziamento della struttura Innovation & Business Intelligence all’interno della Direzione Sales, Marketing & Innovation ManpowerGroup ricerca un*

La struttura Innovation & Business Intelligence supporta la strategia aziendale, mediante l’analisi dei dati a supporto delle decisioni di business e la guida e promozione di progetti di data innovation per creare basi solide per un futuro sempre più all'avanguardia nel mondo dei servizi di HR alle aziende clienti.
Il candidato/a/* supporterà il Responsabile nelle seguenti attività:Definizione di sistemi di intelligenza artificiale mediante la scrittura di programmi con linguaggio Python
Attività di data preparation mediante l’estrazione dei dati dai DW aziendali con query SQL
Attività di data cleaning e data trasformation mediante l’utilizzo delle principali tecniche e programmi di ETL
Attività di data visualization col software MS Power BI
Le caratteristiche della persona che si unirà al Team:Laurea in discipline STEM – in particolare ingegneria informatica, big data analytics, data science, matematica, statistica o affini
6 mesi - 1 anno di esperienza nel ruolo
Interesse e curiosità per il mondo dell’analisi dei dati e della data science
Buona conoscenza di MS Office, in particolare Excel (formule, macro, pivot) e Power Point
Buona conoscenza di MS Power BI
Buona conoscenza del linguaggio SQL e Python
Conoscenza base dei principali software di ETL
Buona capacità di relazione e team working
Buone capacità organizzative e gestione priorità

In ManpowerGroup siamo promotori di un ambiente di lavoro inclusivo, innovativo, stimolante e flessibile, vivendo e mettendo in pratica in nostri Standards Clarity, Care, Grow – e i nostri valori - People, Knowledge e Innovation.

Lavorerai in un gruppo multinazionale che per il quattordicesimo anno è nella classifica delle ""World’s Most Ethical Companies"", un Gruppo che in Italia ha ottenuto la Certificazione sulla Parità di Genere e ha scelto di certificare il proprio impegno per la Responsabilità Sociale con la Certificazione Etica SA8000® .

Ti troverai in un ambiente dinamico che valorizza la collaborazione e che pone attenzione ai propri colleghi e alle proprie colleghe attraverso percorsi di benessere organizzativo, welfare e recognition.

Entrerai in un Gruppo che sviluppa continuamente le competenze dei propri collaboratori e delle proprie collaboratrici attraverso percorsi di formazione e di carriera sia a livello nazionale che internazionale con la possibilità di accedere a job rotation e di spaziare nelle diverse business units.
Modalità di lavoro: ibrida, in presenza e smart working

4066358859,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/ai-product-developer-at-gruppo-san-donato-4066358859?position=20&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=5EJTivHG9TQPMWlw%2BTwcKA%3D%3D,AI Product Developer,Gruppo San Donato,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Gruppo San Donato è alla ricerca di una risorsa da inserire come AI PRODUCT DELEVOPER desideroso di entrare a far parte di un contesto sfidante e in crescita.
La figura del AI PRODUCT DELEVOPER verrà inserita nel team di Segreteria di Presidenza con l’obiettivo di sviluppare ed ottimizzare i prodotti basati sull’intelligenza artificiale.

Il candidato ideale è motivato e dotato di una forte passione per la tecnologia e l’innovazione, è in possesso di una solida comprensione del linguaggio di programmazione Python, preferibilmente con un background statistico e con un’esperienza/formazione pregressa come Data Analyst.
La risorsa inserita dovrà occuparsi di:
-Contribuire allo sviluppo ed al perfezionamento di prodotti AI, collaborando strettamente con il team di prodotto e tecnologia
-Implementare modelli e algoritmi di machine learning utilizzando Python
-Analizzare grandi set di dati per trarne insights e guidare le decisioni di sviluppo del prodotto
-Testare e validare i modelli di previsione per garantire l’accuratezza e l’efficacia
-Preparare report dettagliati sui risultati e le performance dei modelli AI
-Mantenere un aggiornamento continuo sulle ultime tendenze e tecnologie con particolare attenzione al campo AI
-Progettare, sviluppare, implementare e monitorare sistemi di intelligenza artificiale.
-Conoscenza approfondita del mondo AI, innovazione, tecnologia e forte orientamento all’office automation
-Buona conoscenza delle librerie comuni di Data Science come Pandas, NumPy, Scikit-Learn, TensorFlow
-Buone doti di scrittura e chiarezza compositiva
-Proattività, problem solving, curiosità e pensiero innovativo
-Ottime doti organizzative e di gestione delle priorità
-Completano il profilo disponibilità, flessibilità e riservatezza.
Tipo di contratto: subordinato, full time.
La tipologia contrattuale di inserimento verrà valutata in base all’esperienza del candidato.
Entrare a far parte del nostro Gruppo significa intraprendere un percorso di sviluppo personale e professionale in cui Innovazione, Umanità e Sostenibilità siano i valori guida.
Cerchiamo persone entusiaste, che abbiano un approccio proattivo al lavoro, sinceramente interessate al mondo della Sanità e pronte a mettersi in gioco in un contesto dinamico e stimolante.

4076769463,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-italy-bcg-x-at-bcg-x-4076769463?position=26&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=t7e55D%2F3cnpzPvznKl9KMw%3D%3D,"Data Scientist, Italy - BCG X",BCG X,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following
Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
Fluency in both Italian and English

Boston Consulting Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, age, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity / expression, national origin, disability, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected under national, provincial, or local law, where applicable, and those with criminal histories will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable state and local laws.
BCG is an E - Verify Employer. Click here for more information on E-Verify.

Who We Are

Boston Consulting Group partners with leaders in business and society to tackle their most important challenges and capture their greatest opportunities. BCG was the pioneer in business strategy when it was founded in 1963. Today, we help clients with total transformation-inspiring complex change, enabling organizations to grow, building competitive advantage, and driving bottom-line impact.

To succeed, organizations must blend digital and human capabilities. Our diverse, global teams bring deep industry and functional expertise and a range of perspectives to spark change. BCG delivers solutions through leading-edge management consulting along with technology and design, corporate and digital ventures—and business purpose. We work in a uniquely collaborative model across the firm and throughout all levels of the client organization, generating results that allow our clients to thrive.

We Are BCG X

We’re a diverse team of more than 3,000 tech experts united by a drive to make a difference. Working across industries and disciplines, we combine our experience and expertise to tackle the biggest challenges faced by society today. We go beyond what was once thought possible, creating new and innovative solutions to the world’s most complex problems. Leveraging BCG’s global network and partnerships with leading organizations, BCG X provides a stable ecosystem for talent to build game-changing businesses, products, and services from the ground up, all while growing their career. Together, we strive to create solutions that will positively impact the lives of millions.

What You'll Do

Our BCG X teams own the full analytics value-chain end to end: framing new business challenges, designing innovative algorithms, implementing, and deploying scalable solutions, and enabling colleagues and clients to fully embrace AI. Our product offerings span from fully custom-builds to industry specific leading edge AI software solutions.

Our Data Scientists and Senior Data Scientist are part of our rapidly growing team to apply data science methods and analytics to real-world business situations across industries to drive significant business impact. You'll have the chance to partner with clients in a variety of BCG regions and industries, and on key topics like climate change, enabling them to design, build, and deploy new and innovative solutions.

Additional responsibilities will include developing and delivering thought leadership in scientific communities and papers as well as leading conferences on behalf of BCG X. Successful candidates are intellectually curious builders who are biased toward action, creative, and communicative.

We Are Looking For Dedicated Individuals With a Passion For Data Science, Statistics, Operations Research And Redefining Organizations Into AI Led Innovative Companies. Successful Candidates Possess The Following

  • Comfortable in a client-facing role with the ambition to lead teams
  • Likes to distill complex results or processes into simple, clear visualizations
  • Explain sophisticated data science concepts in an understandable manner
  • Love building things and are comfortable working with modern development tools and writing code collaboratively (bonus points if you have a software development or DevOps experience)
  • Significant experience applying advanced analytics to a variety of business situations and a proven ability to synthesize complex data
  • Deep understanding of modern machine learning techniques and their mathematical underpinnings, and can translate this into business implications for our clients
  • Have strong project management skills
  • Fluency in both Italian and English

What You'll Bring

Technologies

Programming Languages: Python

4061327258,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-at-akkodis-4061327258?position=30&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=6z%2FLLBS2bLlQO0hltkNNzA%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer,Akkodis,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Akkodis è un leader globale nel mercato dell'ingegneria e della ricerca e sviluppo che mira ad accelerare l'innovazione e la trasformazione digitale utilizzando la forza dei connected data.
Con la passione per la tecnologia e il talento, il gruppo composto da 50.000 ingegneri ed esperti digitali offre una profonda esperienza intersettoriale in 30 paesi tra Nord America, EMEA e APAC.

Akkodis vanta un’ampia esperienza e un forte know-how in settori tecnologici chiave come la mobilità, i servizi software e tecnologici, la robotica, i test, le simulazioni, la sicurezza dei dati, l'intelligenza artificiale e l'analisi dei dati.

La combinazione di competenze informatiche e ingegneristiche porta a un'offerta unica di soluzioni end-to-end, con quattro linee di servizio - Consulting, Solutions, Talents e Academy - per supportare i clienti nel ripensare ai loro processi di sviluppo prodotto e di business, migliorare la produttività, ridurre al minimo il time-to-market e dare forma a un domani più smart e sostenibile.
Nell’ottica di un potenziamento del nostro team, ricerchiamo una figura di:

La risorsa, all’interno del team di innovazione, si occuperà della ricerca e dello sviluppo di nuove tecnologie emergenti, per supportare e migliorare le attività degli stakeholder interni ed esterni.
Condurre ricerche sulle tecnologie emergenti, in particolare sulle più recenti tecniche di machine e deep learning
Collaborare con team cross-funzionali per progettare e implementare MVP e POC
Collaborare con fornitori esterni per sviluppare e integrare soluzioni SW e HW
Definire le strategie di scaling delle soluzioni testate
Addestrare e ottimizzare modelli di machine learning
Identificare e misurare obiettivi e risultati chiave che guidino il go/no go per lo scaling delle iniziative
La risorsa ideale possiede una Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o similari, ed ha maturato almeno 5 anni di esperienza pregressa in attività simili.
Possiede un forte background tecnico, una mentalità creativa e innovativa e una passione per le tecnologie emergenti.

Sono richieste buona capacità di problem solving e di team working, autonomia nell’organizzazione dei tasks assegnati ed orientamento al risultato. E' inoltre richiesta la disponibilità alla mobilità geografica in ambito nazionale e internazionale ed un’ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese.
Conoscenza teorica delle tecniche di machine learning
Esperienza con framework di deep learning
Consolidata esperienza su linguaggi di sviluppo e markup Java, Javascript, HTML, CSS, PHP, API REST
Conoscenza consolidata delle architetture enterprise e degli strumenti di CI/CD e dei principi agile e DevOps
Conoscenza di database management e SQL
Ottime doti analitiche e di sintesi
Si prevede assunzione a tempo indeterminato
Modalità ibrida su Milano o Perugia

Akkodis è un leader globale nel mercato dell'ingegneria e della ricerca e sviluppo che mira ad accelerare l'innovazione e la trasformazione digitale utilizzando la forza dei connected data.

Con la passione per la tecnologia e il talento, il gruppo composto da 50.000 ingegneri ed esperti digitali offre una profonda esperienza intersettoriale in 30 paesi tra Nord America, EMEA e APAC.

Akkodis vanta un’ampia esperienza e un forte know-how in settori tecnologici chiave come la mobilità, i servizi software e tecnologici, la robotica, i test, le simulazioni, la sicurezza dei dati, l'intelligenza artificiale e l'analisi dei dati.

La combinazione di competenze informatiche e ingegneristiche porta a un'offerta unica di soluzioni end-to-end, con quattro linee di servizio - Consulting, Solutions, Talents e Academy - per supportare i clienti nel ripensare ai loro processi di sviluppo prodotto e di business, migliorare la produttività, ridurre al minimo il time-to-market e dare forma a un domani più smart e sostenibile.


Nell’ottica di un potenziamento del nostro team, ricerchiamo una figura di:


Machine Learning Engineer

La risorsa, all’interno del team di innovazione, si occuperà della ricerca e dello sviluppo di nuove tecnologie emergenti, per supportare e migliorare le attività degli stakeholder interni ed esterni.


Attività e responsabilità:

  • Condurre ricerche sulle tecnologie emergenti, in particolare sulle più recenti tecniche di machine e deep learning
  • Collaborare con team cross-funzionali per progettare e implementare MVP e POC
  • Collaborare con fornitori esterni per sviluppare e integrare soluzioni SW e HW
  • Definire le strategie di scaling delle soluzioni testate
  • Addestrare e ottimizzare modelli di machine learning
  • Identificare e misurare obiettivi e risultati chiave che guidino il go/no go per lo scaling delle iniziative


Profilo

La risorsa ideale possiede una Laurea in Ingegneria Informatica, Informatica o similari, ed ha maturato almeno 5 anni di esperienza pregressa in attività simili.

Possiede un forte background tecnico, una mentalità creativa e innovativa e una passione per le tecnologie emergenti.

Sono richieste buona capacità di problem solving e di team working, autonomia nell’organizzazione dei tasks assegnati ed orientamento al risultato. E' inoltre richiesta la disponibilità alla mobilità geografica in ambito nazionale e internazionale ed un’ottima conoscenza della lingua inglese.


Requisiti

  • Esperienza in Python e R
  • Conoscenza teorica delle tecniche di machine learning
  • Esperienza con framework di deep learning
  • Consolidata esperienza su linguaggi di sviluppo e markup Java, Javascript, HTML, CSS, PHP, API REST
  • Conoscenza consolidata delle architetture enterprise e degli strumenti di CI/CD e dei principi agile e DevOps
  • Conoscenza di database management e SQL
  • Ottime doti analitiche e di sintesi


Offerta

Si prevede assunzione a tempo indeterminato


Sede di Lavoro

Modalità ibrida su Milano o Perugia

4074596203,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/artificial-intelligence-specialist-at-moellhausen-4074596203?position=32&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=7R7n7HaOX3SmnN8HYcQnFQ%3D%3D,Artificial Intelligence Specialist,MOELLHAUSEN,"Vimercate, Lombardy, Italy","Moellhausen SpA (www.moellhausen.com), azienda italiana presente sul mercato da oltre 50 anni e riferimento mondiale nel settore degli aromi e delle fragranze, è alla ricerca di un AI Specialist per il proprio reparto IT.

La risorsa verrà inserita in un nuovo gruppo di lavoro, all'interno dell’area IT e all’interno di un ambiente stimolante e innovativo, potrà mettere a frutto la maturata esperienza per influenzare il percorso di sviluppo del nuovo gruppo, partecipando a progetti all’avanguardia nel campo dell’Intelligenza Artificiale.
Collaborare con il team per sviluppare e implementare soluzioni di IA.
Analizzare e interpretare dati per migliorare i processi decisionali.
Partecipare a progetti di ricerca e sviluppo nel campo dell’IA.
Contribuire alla creazione di modelli predittivi e algoritmi di machine learning.
Mantenere aggiornate le conoscenze sulle ultime tendenze e tecnologie nel campo dell’IA.
Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria o un campo correlato.
Esperienza di almeno 2-3 anni in ruoli simili.
Capacità di lavorare in team e comunicare efficacemente.
Familiarità con librerie di machine learning (es. TensorFlow, PyTorch).
Esperienza nell’utilizzo di LLM tramite API.
Gradita la conoscenza di strumenti di Business Intelligence.

Moellhausen si impegna a creare un ambiente sicuro e inclusivo, basato sul rispetto reciproco e sulla valorizzazione delle diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro a tutti i candidati qualificati.
Il presente annuncio è rivolto a candidati di ogni sesso, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di ogni età e nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.
Gli interessati sono invitati a inviare il proprio curriculum vitae autorizzando il trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 (""GDPR"").

Moellhausen SpA (www.moellhausen.com), azienda italiana presente sul mercato da oltre 50 anni e riferimento mondiale nel settore degli aromi e delle fragranze, è alla ricerca di un AI Specialist per il proprio reparto IT.

La risorsa verrà inserita in un nuovo gruppo di lavoro, all'interno dell’area IT e all’interno di un ambiente stimolante e innovativo, potrà mettere a frutto la maturata esperienza per influenzare il percorso di sviluppo del nuovo gruppo, partecipando a progetti all’avanguardia nel campo dell’Intelligenza Artificiale.

Attività/responsabilità principali

  • Collaborare con il team per sviluppare e implementare soluzioni di IA.
  • Analizzare e interpretare dati per migliorare i processi decisionali.
  • Partecipare a progetti di ricerca e sviluppo nel campo dell’IA.
  • Contribuire alla creazione di modelli predittivi e algoritmi di machine learning.
  • Mantenere aggiornate le conoscenze sulle ultime tendenze e tecnologie nel campo dell’IA.
column2:
Requisiti Richiesti:

  • Laurea in Informatica, Ingegneria o un campo correlato.
  • Esperienza di almeno 2-3 anni in ruoli simili.
  • Capacità di lavorare in team e comunicare efficacemente.
  • Conoscenza di Python e SQL.
  • Familiarità con librerie di machine learning (es. TensorFlow, PyTorch).
  • Esperienza nell’utilizzo di LLM tramite API.
  • Gradita la conoscenza di strumenti di Business Intelligence.


Moellhausen si impegna a creare un ambiente sicuro e inclusivo, basato sul rispetto reciproco e sulla valorizzazione delle diversità, offrendo pari opportunità di lavoro a tutti i candidati qualificati.

Il presente annuncio è rivolto a candidati di ogni sesso, ai sensi delle leggi 903/77 e 125/91, e a persone di ogni età e nazionalità, ai sensi dei decreti legislativi 215/03 e 216/03.

Gli interessati sono invitati a inviare il proprio curriculum vitae autorizzando il trattamento dei dati personali ai sensi dell'art. 13 del Regolamento (UE) 2016/679 (""GDPR"").

4038649402,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/data-scientist-at-saipem-4038649402?position=33&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=Ej%2F2xYKo3c4Z3plF0Eowig%3D%3D,Data Scientist,Saipem,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Saipem is a global leader in the engineering and construction of major projects for the energy and infrastructure sectors, both offshore and onshore. Saipem is “One Company” organized into five business lines - Asset Based Services, Energy Carriers, Offshore Wind, Sustainable Infrastructures, Robotics & Industrialized Solutions. The company has 8 fabrication yards and an offshore fleet of 29 construction vessels (of which 26 owned and 3 owned by third parties and managed by Saipem) and 15 drilling rigs, of which 8 owned. Always oriented towards technological innovation, the company’s purpose is “Engineering for a sustainable future”. As such Saipem is committed to supporting its clients on the energy transition pathway towards Net Zero, with increasingly digital means, technologies and processes geared for environmental sustainability. Listed on the Milan Stock Exchange, it is present in more than 50 countries around the world and employs about 30,000 people of over 120 nationalities.

Always committed to promoting and supporting the values of diversity and inclusion, Saipem confirms its commitment to valuing differences as a source of mutual enrichment. To this end, it promotes and encourages conditions that allow the removal of every obstacle that limits the full expression of people and their complete development within the organization. It protects and guarantees work conditions that respect individual dignity, while promoting a collaborative, harmonious, fair and supportive work environment.

The resource will be part of the important transformation program that involves all Saipem Group and plays a key role in ensuring Digital Transformation projects meet objectives and she/he will govern the data management architectures and the related technology authority methodologies.

The resource will contribute on transformation initiatives related to existing technologies, focusing also on new project digital imprinting leveraging on new technology introduction to meet project requirements.
The Person Will Focus On These Areas
Responsible for designing and evolving of Data Technologies and Data Architecture for the Group.
Identification and selection of new solutions offered by the major Technology Providers.
Ensure that applications and data related services during their evolution are sustainable, maintainable and efficient.
Guide and develop the Data Governance processes and environments, contributing to the definition of the technological and procedural guidelines for the Group.
Guide and develop Machine Learning environment and initiatives.
Design and maintain the lifecycle of data integration and data virtualization tools and services.
Manage project initiatives and govern their delivery.
Support and improve the internal data platform and data ops tools leveraging the new paradigms of data mesh and data fabric.
Ensure that information security risks are properly identified, assessed and managed.
From a Technical Point Of View, Required Knowledges Are
In-depth knowledge of Cloud data platforms and related catalogue offers for the ‘end to end’ design of the data Enterprise architecture.
Excellent knowledge of Informatica, Cloudera and Denodo.
Knowledge of IoT platform and Edge applications will be considered a plus.
Knowledge of cloud computing and the specific features of IaaS, PaaS and SaaS services.
Good knowledge of the Dev & Ops and IAC paradigms and management/evolution of CI / CD pipelines.

Familiarity with relevant data tools and technologies is beneficial. This may include experience with databases (e.g., Sql-and NoSql based databases), data visualization tools (e.g., Qlik, PowerBI), and data analysis platforms (e.g., Pandas, NumPy, TensorFlow).

Knowledge of programming languages commonly used in data analysis, such as Python, R, or SQL, is highly desirable. Understanding how to write efficient code and work with data-related libraries and frameworks can significantly help.
At least 5 years of experience in data management teams, technology system integration or Vendor player and 5 years’ experience in the technology transformation journey and Cloud technologies.
A degree in a relevant field such as Computer Science, Data Science, Mathematics, Statistics, or a related discipline is mandatory together with a strong foundation in STEM subjects.
Experience of working on large-scale software projects.
Good communication skills, flexible and adaptable, collaborative, enthusiastic with a high level of energy, self–motivation, resilience, drive and initiative.

Proficiency in analytical thinking and problem-solving is crucial. This includes the ability to collect, clean, analyze, and interpret data effectively. Familiarity with statistical concepts and methods, as well as experience with data manipulation and visualization, would be advantageous.

Saipem is “One Company” organized into five business lines - Asset Based Services, Energy Carriers, Offshore Wind, Sustainable Infrastructures, Robotics &amp

3963166499,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/machine-learning-engineer-at-open-search-network-3963166499?position=42&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=k8vdwOPcCu0TblWnbY4%2FBQ%3D%3D,Machine Learning Engineer,Open Search Network,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","Our client, a prestigious company that offers advisory services to support digital innovation to companies and public administrations, is looking to hire a:
Experience: Between 3 and 5 years of working experience
Skills: ML, Deep learning, NLP, Python
Developing Machine Learning and Deep Learning algorithms to solve business problems in various industries
Designing and implementing robust and scalable machine learning pipelines, with a focus on NLP and generative AI
Managing continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) of AI models
Contributing to the development of new products and services in the field of NLP and generative AI
Providing technical consultancy and support to clients in defining Data strategy
Collaborating with data science and software development teams to effectively integrate AI models into product solutions.
Experience with machine learning tools and frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar
Experience with Docker and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
Project management skills and ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
Strong interest and knowledge of current trends in generative AI
Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
Experience in consulting or client-facing environments
Adaptability and quick learning in emerging technologies
Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
Between 3 and 5 years of experience in ML engineering roles, preferably in NLP and generative AI

Our client, a prestigious company that offers advisory services to support digital innovation to companies and public administrations, is looking to hire a:


Machine Learning Engineer

(Milan/Italy)


Company: Consulting

Experience: Between 3 and 5 years of working experience

Skills: ML, Deep learning, NLP, Python


Tasks


  • Developing Machine Learning and Deep Learning algorithms to solve business problems in various industries
  • Designing and implementing robust and scalable machine learning pipelines, with a focus on NLP and generative AI
  • Managing continuous integration and continuous deployment (CI/CD) of AI models
  • Contributing to the development of new products and services in the field of NLP and generative AI
  • Producing reports and/or presentations
  • Providing technical consultancy and support to clients in defining Data strategy
  • Collaborating with data science and software development teams to effectively integrate AI models into product solutions.


Skills


  • Excellent software development skills
  • Excellent knowledge of Python
  • Experience with machine learning tools and frameworks like TensorFlow, PyTorch, or similar
  • Experience with Docker and cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, GCP)
  • Project management skills and ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams
  • Strong interest and knowledge of current trends in generative AI
  • Ability to communicate complex technical concepts to non-technical stakeholders
  • Experience in consulting or client-facing environments
  • Adaptability and quick learning in emerging technologies


Requirements


  • Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering, or related field
  • Between 3 and 5 years of experience in ML engineering roles, preferably in NLP and generative AI

Would you like to get involved and join a dynamic company?
You are in the right place!
Contents is looking for an enthusiastic Data Scientist to join our team.
Design, test and implement ML models
Design and implement machine learning pipelines and models, including Ensemble methods, Recommender System, NLP, and Deep Learning
Manage and implement Recommender System algorithms, such as Non-personalized Recommender, Content-based Recommender, Collaborative Filter, etc.
Develop and implement real-time ML models, exposing ML results through API
Design and conduct tests of new projects to analyze and monitor the results of our products and websites
Collaborate with our software engineers and vendors to integrate ML algorithms into our applications
Develop and apply end-to-end NLP/NLG methodologies for content creation.
Have a degree in data science or a STEM field such as statistics, mathematics, physics
Have experience in data science and data analysis, including statistical analysis, A/B testing, and conducting experiments in large-scale environments
Experience with Colab, Jupiter, Spyder, PyCharm
Are experienced in developing NLG algorithms
Have excellent programming skills and understanding of software architectures
Knowledge of NLP models such as BERT and Python libraries such as Tensorflow, PyTorch, Transformers
Have an understanding of the fundamentals of REST APIs
Have an independent spirit and can manage multiple projects simultaneously
Know how to express yourself wisely, clearly, and with just the right touch of charisma.
Attention to people. For this reason, also this year, we are a Great Place to Work, ranked among the Companies where you work Best in Italy!
Young, dynamic, and proactive working environment.
Hybrid work. We do everything we can to adapt to flexibility.
Fun. Unexpected team building events, Family and friends days, and happy hours with colleagues, to name a few of the initiatives.
Want you a mini-spoiler on Contents?
Contents is revolutionizing the way enterprises manage and deploy digital content, offering a bespoke all-in-one platform for content creation and workflow management.
By bridging the gap between AI platforms, digital properties, and data-driven strategies, we empower our clients to enhance their online presence and drive deeper audience engagement.

We are an equal-opportunity employer and highly value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

4051210071,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/marketing-data-scientist-ftc-1-year-at-yoox-net-a-porter-4051210071?position=50&pageNum=0&refId=lc4gcdCQt%2FhohrlkexXaHQ%3D%3D&trackingId=S7qAz3dyonEPfqOYj0AVKQ%3D%3D,Marketing Data Scientist (FTC - 1 Year),YOOX NET-A-PORTER,"Milan, Lombardy, Italy","YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP is the world leader in online luxury and fashion which comprises a complete luxury retail ecosystem. The Group sells directly to customers globally through its own family of multi-brand online shops NET-A-PORTER, MR PORTER, YOOX and THE OUTNET. The Group’s Online Flagship Stores Division partners with many leading luxury brands to power their own e-commerce destinations.

The Group has 4.3 million high-spending active customers globally. As pioneers in bringing together the realms of technology and luxury, YOOX NET-A-PORTER satisfies the most discerning clientele with expertly curated products from the world’s most coveted brands, personalized end-to-end service, the latest technology, and inspiring content, all shaped by 20 years of insights into the modern shopper.

As a global Centre of Excellence, our Digital Marketing Department is aimed to further develop our digital capabilities and create synergies across the business, as well as responsible for driving customer growth encompassing all Digital Marketing actions at the service of our stores.

Our Digital Marketing Division are now seeking a strong, creative and analytical  Marketing Data Scientist to join the team, who will be responsible for planning, executing and managing paid campaigns.
Some of the essentials for you to know are:
Location: our offices in Milan, Italy
Reporting into: Data Science Product Manager
Here is a breakdown of what you’ll be doing:

As a Data Scientist at YOOX NET-A-PORTER Group you will be tackling a wide variety of data challenges including product recommendation, customer value and propensity modelling, and customer and product segmentation.
Work with stakeholders throughout the business to encourage a data-driven approach through the delivery of automated data products and accessible, actionable insight.
Identify opportunities to improve the efficiency of the Data Science team through improved work practices and the development of data assets.
Partner with technology teams to develop the right data, toolsets & platform to enable the benefits of the team’s work to be realised by the business.
The type of person we are looking for:
Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Statistics, or related field.
Good knowledge and experience of Python, Spark and SQL.
Strong foundation in key topics of statistics including sample selection, probability, hypothesis testing and linear regression.
Strong understanding of key machine learning algorithms including logistic regression, decision trees, random forests, k-means clustering.
Proven track record of applying machine learning algorithms to solve commercial problems.
A clear focus on the development of actionable insight.
Ability to work proactively to solve loosely defined problems.
Comfortable communicating with a non-technical audience.
Fluency both in Italian and English

From the moment you join the YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP we are committed to making your journey with us inspirational and evolutionary. If you are passionate, committed and thrive in a collaborative and fast-paced environment, then please apply with a CV.

YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP is an equal opportunities employer, we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply. We recognize and celebrate the benefits that diversity brings to our workplace, our business and our customers. We welcome and will consider all applications regardless of race and nationality, religion, color, sex, pregnancy or related medical conditions, parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.
If you require any reasonable adjustments to complete your application, please do not hesitate to advise us accordingly.

YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP is the world leader in online luxury and fashion which comprises a complete luxury retail ecosystem. The Group sells directly to customers globally through its own family of multi-brand online shops NET-A-PORTER, MR PORTER, YOOX and THE OUTNET. The Group’s Online Flagship Stores Division partners with many leading luxury brands to power their own e-commerce destinations.  

 

The Group has 4.3 million high-spending active customers globally. As pioneers in bringing together the realms of technology and luxury, YOOX NET-A-PORTER satisfies the most discerning clientele with expertly curated products from the world’s most coveted brands, personalized end-to-end service, the latest technology, and inspiring content, all shaped by 20 years of insights into the modern shopper. 

 

As a global Centre of Excellence, our Digital Marketing Department is aimed to further develop our digital capabilities and create synergies across the business, as well as responsible for driving customer growth encompassing all Digital Marketing actions at the service of our stores. 

Our Digital Marketing Division are now seeking a strong, creative and analytical  Marketing Data Scientist to join the team, who will be responsible for planning, executing and managing paid campaigns.

Some of the essentials for you to know are:

Location: our offices in Milan, Italy

Reporting into: Data Science Product Manager

Contract type: Fixed Term (12-months)

Working Model: Hybrid

Here is a breakdown of what you’ll be doing:


  • As a Data Scientist at YOOX NET-A-PORTER Group you will be tackling a wide variety of data challenges including product recommendation, customer value and propensity modelling, and customer and product segmentation.
  • Work with stakeholders throughout the business to encourage a data-driven approach through the delivery of automated data products and accessible, actionable insight.
  • Identify opportunities to improve the efficiency of the Data Science team through improved work practices and the development of data assets.
  • Partner with technology teams to develop the right data, toolsets &
column2:
platform to enable the benefits of the team’s work to be realised by the business.


The type of person we are looking for:


  • Bachelor’s or Master’s degree in Computer Science, Data Engineering, Statistics, or related field.
  • Good knowledge and experience of Python, Spark and SQL.
  • Strong foundation in key topics of statistics including sample selection, probability, hypothesis testing and linear regression.
  • Strong understanding of key machine learning algorithms including logistic regression, decision trees, random forests, k-means clustering.
  • Proven track record of applying machine learning algorithms to solve commercial problems.
  • A clear focus on the development of actionable insight.
  • Ability to work proactively to solve loosely defined problems.
  • Comfortable communicating with a non-technical audience.
  • Fluency both in Italian and English


From the moment you join the YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP we are committed to making your journey with us inspirational and evolutionary. If you are passionate, committed and thrive in a collaborative and fast-paced environment, then please apply with a CV.

YOOX NET-A-PORTER GROUP is an equal opportunities employer, we encourage people with a diverse range of backgrounds to apply. We recognize and celebrate the benefits that diversity brings to our workplace, our business and our customers. We welcome and will consider all applications regardless of race and nationality, religion, color, sex, pregnancy or related medical conditions, parental status, sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, status as an individual with a disability, or any other legally protected characteristics.

If you require any reasonable adjustments to complete your application, please do not hesitate to advise us accordingly.

Experience Level: Entry level

Workplace Type: Hybrid
